entry.title: config.mk: remove -lc
entry.content:
commit 12069466ff230ca3b1dafe77c0fb98b8f1d9c658 parent 30116a4ef2c1d90a3662b2878e54f3da2fc56894 Author: Hiltjo Posthuma <hiltjo@codemadness.org> Date: Sat Jul 2 12:44:34 +0200
config.mk: remove -lc
Thanks quinq!
POSIX/quinq says:
"In the absence of options that inhibit invocation of the link editor, such as -c or -E, the c99 utility shall cause the equivalent of a -l c option to be passed to the link editor after the last pathname operand or -l option, causing it to be searched after all other object files and libraries are loaded."

entry.title: cache support (-c option)
entry.content:
commit 1a3584e2d0689aece46d9832c91f57723296807f parent ede93fa7ee0af8e6e858981e1a7e5057646487ce Author: Hiltjo Posthuma <hiltjo@codemadness.org> Date: Sun May 1 17:54:14 +0200
cache support (-c option)
"Optionally the -c cachefile option can be used to cache the entries of the log page up to the point of the last commit. The cachefile will store the last commit id and the entries in the HTML table."
this caches the diffstat and commits, it is an expensive operation (twss).

entry.title: optimization: suppress large diffs
entry.content:
commit 7067223104f028ba85deaa1996c892ddfb8230dd parent 914880f31b04222fa2815f4f35543b72f881d5e4 Author: Hiltjo Posthuma <hiltjo@codemadness.org> Date: Sat Apr 30 12:00:33 +0200
optimization: suppress large diffs
the values are arbitrary, these can be tweaked later if needed.

entry.title: optimization: read stats once and remember it
entry.content:
commit 914880f31b04222fa2815f4f35543b72f881d5e4 parent 0bc47da0f7b66614cdf499755ceca1dc13ff91cd Author: Hiltjo Posthuma <hiltjo@codemadness.org> Date: Sat Apr 30 11:54:33 +0200
optimization: read stats once and remember it
for an initial run and new commits this speeds stagit up a bit: on an initial run of sbase goes from about 4 seconds to 2.8 on my machine.
now we can't use statsbuf, so create the stats string ourselves, while at it color the + and - using a style (can be disabled for the color-haters out there ;)).

submodule support
- detect .gitmodules file for submodules, add a link "submodules" to the top menu. - link each submodule to the .gitmodules file in HEAD. - revert the special style for modules, but list it as a file "m---------", don't show the line/filesize though, it is not a file.

entry.title: Fix null pointer access for submodules in writefilestree
entry.content:
commit b8af751b0108edcad02bc59cec496b1d7808b0e1 parent 375d41dcce94106460f1b3855ebb295ccb138593 Author: Quentin Rameau <quinq@fifth.space> Date: Fri Apr 29 14:01:45 +0200
Fix null pointer access for submodules in writefilestree
Do not try to set a link to submodules from bare repo as we can't get the actual url.

entry.title: tweak style of showing submodules
entry.content:
commit 375d41dcce94106460f1b3855ebb295ccb138593 parent 571076b419daec91efb5e5d39dd17066e43805bc Author: Hiltjo Posthuma <hiltjo@codemadness.org> Date: Fri Apr 29 12:32:36 +0200
tweak style of showing submodules
this will make it look similar to cgit. show mode as "m---------"

entry.title: Don't fail on submodules
entry.content:
commit 571076b419daec91efb5e5d39dd17066e43805bc parent 28730218c4b68e9b3a0f7ce628868bb647d97f9e Author: z3bra <willyatmailoodotorg> Date: Fri Apr 29 01:40:30 +0200
Don't fail on submodules
Submodules will get listed prefixed with a '@', using a specific CSS class for styling. The href will be set to the url of the submodule. Filesize will appear as 0 and filemode will not be printed to avoid an awkward mode: "?---------".
In writefilestree, we don't return anymore if an entry can't be categorized as an object, but rather, fail if we can't retrieve its name.

entry.title: resolve absolute paths to repodir, remove basename just use strrchr.
entry.content:
commit 8df54926f2ad80ae46a4cc701f3341e97839e0c8 parent 70b777831a80a7a204f02697563d39dba612c8c4 Author: Hiltjo Posthuma <hiltjo@codemadness.org> Date: Wed Apr 27 19:19:50 +0200
resolve absolute paths to repodir, remove basename just use strrchr.
- resolve repodir, for example: stagit-index ../ used to use ".." as the name, now it will resolve to the real directory name. - just use strrchr(path, '/') instead of basename, '/' path separator is now used.

entry.title: atom feed: add link, move content order to bottom
entry.content:
commit 8bf328befabb4d95fa7bf8036f6309e4cd26570d parent 5578784dda58fd79556bdc937e64f179d7ce5ea9 Author: Hiltjo Posthuma <hiltjo@codemadness.org> Date: Tue Feb 23 20:44:00 +0100

NOTE: using relative links violates the Atom specification, but relative links are convenient aswell.

entry.title: fix file tree handling
entry.content:
commit 502b95ce68ef3e08fb536a0d22c267dcd3e9c7fc parent 9693d1d1a965006c14d43a8e73aa9cc4f512e75f Author: Quentin Rameau <quinq@fifth.space> Date: Mon Jan 18 12:47:25 +0100
fix file tree handling
Do not forget to keep previous path when recursing or we end up with filenames only.

entry.title: fix file size byte unit suffix
entry.content:
commit 4f56d5dec6c8fa5aabcac0154235fedeebe1f186 parent d8bad43b3c67a344fe78b6bdab36d414ed9ff13b Author: Quentin Rameau <quinq@fifth.space> Date: Sun Jan 10 00:48:01 +0100
fix file size byte unit suffix
Correct suffix for byte is B, b is for bit.

entry.title: stop glibc complaining about _BSD_SOURCE being deprecated
entry.content:
commit d8bad43b3c67a344fe78b6bdab36d414ed9ff13b parent 79fab7c6faf78d7bcc0c870359138617aee24c7d Author: Quentin Rameau <quinq@fifth.space> Date: Sun Jan 10 00:47:45 +0100
stop glibc complaining about _BSD_SOURCE being deprecated

entry.title: replace file size with line count for text files
entry.content:
commit 79fab7c6faf78d7bcc0c870359138617aee24c7d parent 50dccf0e3ba06bcd732ac5c38c8b326cebc6c097 Author: Quentin Rameau <quinq@fifth.space> Date: Sun Jan 10 00:47:22 +0100
replace file size with line count for text files
Keep the number of line when writing text blobs and print it in the index file tree instead of the size. Still print the size otherwise.

entry.title: No need for -D_POSIX_C_SOURCE=200809L
entry.content:
commit cae9950407009652d52a2c140d136d3f14b4095c parent bd854ac71fe7045b74accc57b5e1933b411033be Author: sin <sin@2f30.org> Date: Wed Jan 6 17:18:58 +0000
No need for -D_POSIX_C_SOURCE=200809L
XOPEN is a superset.
